Name: American Eagle
Description: American clothing and accessories retailer headquartered at SouthSide Works in Pittsburgh.
Reason: American Eagle posted an image of the Israeli Flag on their flagship billboard in Times Square showing their support for the apartheid state.
How to Boycott: Dont buy products from American Eagle Outfitters. Don't work for American Eagle Outfitters.
Alternatives: Buy non designer products.

Name: Bulgari / Bvlgari
Description: A fashion brand owned by Bernard Arnaults company, LVMH
Reason: The owner of Bulgari's parent company, LVMH, Bernard Arnault invests hundreds of millions in Israeli companies
How to Boycott: Don't buy Bulgari products. Don't sell Bulgari products. Don't work for Bulgari or LVMH.
Alternatives: Unbranded oil based fragrances. Non designer clothing and accessories. Lush cosmetics. Huda beauty. Sunnamusk.

Description: A fashion brand owned by Bernard Arnaults company, LVMH
Reason: The owner of Celine's parent company, LVMH, Bernard Arnault invests hundreds of millions in Israeli companies
How to Boycott: Don't buy Celine products. Don't sell Celine products. Don't work for Celine or LVMH.
Alternatives: Unbranded oil based fragrances. Non designer clothing and accessories. Lush cosmetics. Huda beauty. Sunnamusk.

Name: Chanel
Description: French luxury fashion house in Paris. It is privately owned by the Wertheimer family.
Reason: Alain Wertheimer, condemned the attack on Israel but remained silent on the attacks on Gaza, also pledged $4m in Chanel's name.
How to Boycott: Dont buy Chanel clothing, make up, shoes, perfumes, bags or any other products. Don't sell Chanel products. Don't work for Chanel.
Alternatives: Lush cosmetics. Huda beauty. Sunnamusk. Unbranded oil based perfumes.

Name: Diesel Frangrances
Description: Partnership between fashion house Diesel and L'Oreal to produce their frangrances range.
Reason: Diesel Frangrances is a partnership with L'Oreal, which is a 'warm friend of Israel'. After sending a letter to the Arab League with information helping the boycott, they paid a $1.4m fine and issued an apology, before fostering a new relationship with Israel, with heavy investment and even operating a factory in Occupied Palestine.
How to Boycott: Don't buy Diesel Frangrances products. Don't sell Diesel Frangrances products. Don't work for L'Oreal Groupe.
Alternatives: Unbranded oil based perfumes. Sunnamusk.
